turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Certainly! Standard deviation essentially measures the spread of data points around the mean (average). A low standard deviation indicates that the data points tend to be close to the mean, while a high standard deviation indicates that the data points are spread out over a wider range. turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Okay, let's break down the formula step-by-step. First, you calculate the mean of your data set. Then, for each data point, you subtract the mean and square the result. Next, you find the average of those squared differences. Finally, you take the square root of that average. That final value is the standard deviation. We can work through an example if that helps.
